ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Processing Disorder (APD)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Normal peripheral hearing sensitivity (except mild loss at 8k) with significant deficits in speech-in-noise, auditory figure-ground, and dichotic listening tasks.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Peripheral Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out as primary cause; audiogram is normal 250-4000 Hz with only mild loss at 8000 Hz, which does not explain the degree of difficulty in noise.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear Pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out by previous normal ABR and MRI.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Cognitive or Language Disorder
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out by previous normal SLP evaluation including language and cognitive-linguistic tests.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Assess peripheral hearing sensitivity to rule out significant hearing loss.
Assess word recognition ability in ideal listening conditions.
Evaluate speech understanding in the presence of background noise.
Comprehensive battery to assess central auditory processing skills including figure-ground and filtered words.
Assess dichotic listening and auditory integration abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Peripheral hearing is essentially normal, but comprehensive APD testing reveals significant deficits in auditory integration (dichotic listening) and speech understanding in noise (figure-ground). Temporal processing and phonological synthesis are intact.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal limits 250-4000 Hz; mild sensorineural hearing loss at 8000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise (W-22)
tests.result_summary: Significant deficit in noise; WRS dropped to 80% (Right) and 76% (Left) with +5 dB SNR. Quiet/Noise difference of 20-24% is abnormal.

tests.name: SCAN-3A (Auditory Processing Battery)
tests.result_summary: Abnormal Auditory Figure-Ground (0 and +8 dB), Filtered Words, and Competing Words. Normal Competing Sentences and Time Compressed Sentences.

tests.name: Staggered Spondaic Word (SSW) Test
tests.result_summary: Significant integration deficits (Left Competing errors: 8) and abnormal Ear Effect (Low/High difference of 5).

proposed_items: Auditory training program (e.g., Dichotic Onset Training [DOT], CAPDOTS)
Discontinue hearing aid use as they are not beneficial for this APD profile
counseling_actions: Explain that normal peripheral hearing combined with processing deficits causes difficulty in noise
Clarify why hearing aids amplified noise without improving clarity
Discuss that APD can be present in adults and is treatable with training
Advise on strategies to improve listening environment where possible

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for specific auditory training (DOT program and SIN training) to address confirmed APD deficits.

follow_up_plan.objective: Repeat auditory processing assessment to evaluate effectiveness of training.

expected_outcome: Repeated auditory processing testing revealed normal findings on all measures.
WRS in noise (+5 dB SNR) showed quiet/noise difference of 8% (Right) and 12% (Left), within normal limits.
SSW test revealed normal findings for all conditions, with only 2 errors for the LC condition and no significant Ear Effect.
SCAN-3A results were normal for all measures with scaled scores of 9 (37th percentile) or better.
Patient reported being better able to participate in social situations.
